item.title: The Summer Game Fest and (not) E3 2023 full schedule | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Illustration: Polygon/Summer Game Fest A rundown of all the big gaming events coming this summer This year‚Äôs E3 has been canceled, but that won‚Äôt stop game publishers like Sony, Microsoft, and Ubiso...
item.content:encoded: Illustration: Polygon/Summer Game Fest A rundown of all the big gaming events coming this summer This year‚Äôs E3 has been canceled, but that won‚Äôt stop game publishers like Sony, Microsoft, and Ubisoft from holding their own digital showcases throughout the summer ‚Äî or Geoff Keighley‚Äôs ever-expanding Summer Game Fest event from providing a good alternative to the video game announcement blowout one would have expected from E3 2023. While Nintendo has not yet announced any kind of Nintendo Direc...

item.title: Minecraft‚Äôs newest update arrives, introducing a chill cherry-blossom biome | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Mojang Find an egg and hatch a loyal Sniffer to find rare seeds A new patch is out for Minecraft today on both Java and Bedrock editions. Trails and Tales, also known as the patch 1.20 update...
item.content:encoded: Image: Mojang Find an egg and hatch a loyal Sniffer to find rare seeds A new patch is out for Minecraft today on both Java and Bedrock editions. Trails and Tales, also known as the patch 1.20 update, introduces the cherry-blossom biome, new bookshelves, and signs for cozy cottage aesthetics, the archeology profession, camels, and a new creature named the Sniffer. Mojang first announced Trails & Tales in February, then tested the update on Java snapshots and Bedrock betas. The marquee feature o...

item.title: Where to pre-order Final Fantasy 16, and what comes with each edition | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: FFXVI is shaping up to be a stunning game. | Image: Square Enix June 22 is closer than you think. Here‚Äôs where you can reserve your copy of the game Final Fantasy 16 will launch exclusively on the P...
item.content:encoded: FFXVI is shaping up to be a stunning game. | Image: Square Enix June 22 is closer than you think. Here‚Äôs where you can reserve your copy of the game Final Fantasy 16 will launch exclusively on the PlayStation 5 on Thursday, June 22. While the latest installment appears to lack the road trip bromances of its predecessor, it still retains the franchise‚Äôs penchant for audacious fashion and unrealistically sized swords. Now, it's likely that the game will eventually make it onto PC and Xbox, but i...

item.title: Disney Lorcana launch threatened by Upper Deck lawsuit | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Ravensburger It alleges publisher Ravensburger and co-designer Ryan Miller stole its intellectual property The pending launch of Ravensburger‚Äôs Disney Lorcana trading card game is now threate...
item.content:encoded: Image: Ravensburger It alleges publisher Ravensburger and co-designer Ryan Miller stole its intellectual property The pending launch of Ravensburger‚Äôs Disney Lorcana trading card game is now threatened by an explosive new lawsuit issued by The Upper Deck Company. In the 19-page complaint, issued today to a California court, the rival publisher alleges that co-designer Ryan Miller previously created a similar game that is ‚Äúnearly identical‚Äù to Disney Lorcana while under contract with Upper Deck...

item.title: Evaluating speech synthesis in many languages with SQuId | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Thibault Sellam, Research Scientist, Google Previously, we presented the 1,000 languages initiative and the Universal Speech Model with the goal of making speech and language technologi...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Thibault Sellam, Research Scientist, Google Previously, we presented the 1,000 languages initiative and the Universal Speech Model with the goal of making speech and language technologies available to billions of users around the world. Part of this commitment involves developing high-quality speech synthesis technologies, which build upon projects such as VDTTS and AudioLM, for users that speak many different languages. listening tests, during which dozens of annotators lis...

item.title: I wish Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom would let me collect hearts in other ways¬† | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon Shrines feel like the biggest caveat to the open-world experience The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom feels like a giant playpen where players can run a...
item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon Shrines feel like the biggest caveat to the open-world experience The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom feels like a giant playpen where players can run around like a bunch of kids causing chaos in the best way possible. Thanks to a new set of powers and items, Link can build anything from skateboards to twisted devices that torture Koroks. Pair that with a sprawling world, and Tears of the Kingdom gives players ample opportunity to experience its wo...

item.title: Coca-Cola‚Äôs new League of Legends collaboration claims to taste like leveling up | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: The Coca-Cola Company What do experience points taste like? This soda, apparently There are tons of twists on the classic Coca-Cola formula, like vanilla, cherry, or zesty lime. But the flavo...
item.content:encoded: Image: The Coca-Cola Company What do experience points taste like? This soda, apparently There are tons of twists on the classic Coca-Cola formula, like vanilla, cherry, or zesty lime. But the flavor that‚Äôs apparently meant to appeal to gamers is the Coca-Cola Ultimate Zero Sugar, which is a flavor meant to evoke the taste of an experience point. The soda is part of a larger collaboration with Riot Games, and it comes in a snazzy black-and-gold can. Coca-Cola and Riot Games announced the new c...

item.title: Overwatch 2‚Äôs next season to dethrone Junker Queen, make Tracer an elf | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Blizzard Entertainment Season 5 adds a new way to unlock Mythic skins Overwatch 2 season 5 starts on June 13, and players who pay for the game‚Äôs premium battle pass have a new Mythic skin to ...
item.content:encoded: Image: Blizzard Entertainment Season 5 adds a new way to unlock Mythic skins Overwatch 2 season 5 starts on June 13, and players who pay for the game‚Äôs premium battle pass have a new Mythic skin to look forward to: Adventurer Tracer, who not only looks sharp and stylish, but introduces a new tier-unlocking scheme for the game‚Äôs Mythic skins. Mythic Adventurer Tracer gives the series‚Äô cover star hero a fantasy elf appearance, with an optional cowl and fancy armor that offers a rogue-like look. ...

item.description: Bills quarterback Josh Allen. | Photo: Cooper Neill/Getty Images Quarterback Josh Allen takes this year‚Äôs honor Josh Allen, the All-Pro quarterback for the NFL‚Äôs Buffalo Bills, graces the cover of M...
item.content:encoded: Bills quarterback Josh Allen. | Photo: Cooper Neill/Getty Images Quarterback Josh Allen takes this year‚Äôs honor Josh Allen, the All-Pro quarterback for the NFL‚Äôs Buffalo Bills, graces the cover of Madden NFL 24 ‚Äî both its standard edition and its deluxe edition. It‚Äôs the first time the Bills have landed a player on the league‚Äôs official video game. Image: EA Sports Image: EA Sports Since Madden NFL began the tradition of an annual cover star representing the game (with Eddie George in Madd...

item.title: Diablo 4‚Äôs onslaught of MMO features hints at a questionable live-service future | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Blizzard Entertainment The writing has improved, but the organic tension has largely evaporated The first time I see another player roaming around Estuar in Diablo 4, even before their friend...
item.content:encoded: Image: Blizzard Entertainment The writing has improved, but the organic tension has largely evaporated The first time I see another player roaming around Estuar in Diablo 4, even before their friendly green nameplate registers in my brain, I reflexively open fire with the righteous fury of a mindless exterminator sent to cleanse the land of evil. Sorry, other person, for mistaking you for an abnormally large Fallen; my first reflex is to machine-gun fireball anything that moves because I grew ...

item.title: Madden 24 scraps dud modes for a return to Superstar and Rushing Attack | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: EA Orlando/Electronic Arts Face of the Franchise is done, and so is The Yard Madden NFL 24 returns this August with yet another promise of polishing the chaotic gameplay of 11-on-11 football ...
item.content:encoded: Image: EA Orlando/Electronic Arts Face of the Franchise is done, and so is The Yard Madden NFL 24 returns this August with yet another promise of polishing the chaotic gameplay of 11-on-11 football ‚Äî the core demand of John Madden himself ‚Äî but also some significant changes to its suite of modes. Gone is Face of the Franchise, the attempt at a narrative, single-player mode starring a user-created player that EA Sports introduced in Madden NFL 20 and iterated on since then. Instead, the old Sup...

item.description: Based on reinforcement learning, our AI models AlphaZero and MuZero have achieved superhuman performance winning games. Now, they‚Äôre expanding their capabilities to help optimise resources in data cen...
item.content:encoded: Based on reinforcement learning, our AI models AlphaZero and MuZero have achieved superhuman performance winning games. Now, they‚Äôre expanding their capabilities to help optimise resources in data centres and advance video compression ‚Äì and most recently, our specialised version of AlphaZero, called AlphaDev, discovered new algorithms that are already accelerating the software applications at the foundations of our digital society.

item.content:encoded: Posted by Ruofei Du, Research Scientist, and Alex Olwal, Senior Staff Research Scientist, Google Augmented Reality Recent advances in video conferencing have significantly improved remote video communication through features like live captioning and noise cancellation. However, there are various situations where dynamic visual augmentation would be useful to better convey complex and nuanced information. For example, when discussing what to order at a Japanese restaurant, your friends could ...

The tentative program can be found here. I am one of the members of the organizing committee for this workshop, together with Petros Koumoutsakos, Jordan Ellenberg, Melvin Greer, Brendan Hassett, [‚Ä¶]

item.title: AVFormer: Injecting vision into frozen speech models for zero-shot AV-ASR | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Arsha Nagrani and Paul Hongsuck Seo, Research Scientists, Google Research Automatic speech recognition (ASR) is a well-established technology that is widely adopted for various applica...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Arsha Nagrani and Paul Hongsuck Seo, Research Scientists, Google Research Automatic speech recognition (ASR) is a well-established technology that is widely adopted for various applications such as conference calls, streamed video transcription and voice commands. While the challenges for this technology are centered around noisy audio inputs, the visual stream in multimodal videos (e.g., TV, online edited videos) can provide strong cues for improving the robustness of ASR system...

item.description: Posted by Ziniu Hu, Student Researcher, and Alireza Fathi, Research Scientist, Google Research, Perception Team Large-scale models, such as T5, GPT-3, PaLM, Flamingo and PaLI, have demonstrated t...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Ziniu Hu, Student Researcher, and Alireza Fathi, Research Scientist, Google Research, Perception Team Large-scale models, such as T5, GPT-3, PaLM, Flamingo and PaLI, have demonstrated the ability to store substantial amounts of knowledge when scaled to tens of billions of parameters and trained on large text and image datasets. These models achieve state-of-the-art results on downstream tasks, such as image captioning, visual question answering and open vocabulary recognition. Des...

item.title: Large sequence models for software development activities | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Petros Maniatis and Daniel Tarlow, Research Scientists, Google Software isn‚Äôt created in one dramatic step. It improves bit by bit, one little step at a time ‚Äî editing, running unit test...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Petros Maniatis and Daniel Tarlow, Research Scientists, Google Software isn‚Äôt created in one dramatic step. It improves bit by bit, one little step at a time ‚Äî editing, running unit tests, fixing build errors, addressing code reviews, editing some more, appeasing linters, and fixing more errors ‚Äî until finally it becomes good enough to merge into a code repository. Software engineering isn‚Äôt an isolated process, but a dialogue among human developers, code reviewers, bug reporters, ...

item.content:encoded: Open source tools have had a pivotal role in the evolution of data science, from providing the foundation for analysis, to fueling the innovation that shapes today's landscape. The open source impact on data science is demonstrated best by looking at the relationship's past, present, and future.

item.content:encoded: Posted by Julian Eisenschlos, Research Software Engineer, Google Research Visual language is the form of communication that relies on pictorial symbols outside of text to convey information. It is ubiquitous in our digital life in the form of iconography, infographics, tables, plots, and charts, extending to the real world in street signs, comic books, food labels, etc. For that reason, having computers better understand this type of media can help with scientific communication and discover...

item.title: Barkour: Benchmarking animal-level agility with quadruped robots | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Ken Caluwaerts and Atil Iscen, Research Scientists, Google Creating robots that exhibit robust and dynamic locomotion capabilities, similar to animals or humans, has been a long-standin...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Ken Caluwaerts and Atil Iscen, Research Scientists, Google Creating robots that exhibit robust and dynamic locomotion capabilities, similar to animals or humans, has been a long-standing goal in the robotics community. In addition to completing tasks quickly and efficiently, agility allows legged robots to move through complex environments that are otherwise difficult to traverse. Researchers at Google have been pursuing agility for multiple years and across various form factors. ...

item.description: Posted by Vincent Cohen-Addad and Alessandro Epasto, Research Scientists, Google Research, Graph Mining team Clustering is a central problem in unsupervised machine learning (ML) with many applica...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Vincent Cohen-Addad and Alessandro Epasto, Research Scientists, Google Research, Graph Mining team Clustering is a central problem in unsupervised machine learning (ML) with many applications across domains in both industry and academic research more broadly. At its core, clustering consists of the following problem: given a set of data elements, the goal is to partition the data elements into groups such that similar objects are in the same group, while dissimilar objects are in d...

item.title: An early warning system for novel AI risks | DeepMind Blog
item.description: AI researchers already use a range of evaluation benchmarks to identify unwanted behaviours in AI systems, such as AI systems making misleading statements, biased decisions, or repeating copyrighted c...
item.content:encoded: AI researchers already use a range of evaluation benchmarks to identify unwanted behaviours in AI systems, such as AI systems making misleading statements, biased decisions, or repeating copyrighted content. Now, as the AI community builds and deploys increasingly powerful AI, we must expand the evaluation portfolio to include the possibility of extreme risks from general-purpose AI models that have strong skills in manipulation, deception, cyber-offense, or other dangerous capabilities.
